posts.post_content: I play a wall/land destruction deck with [Limited Resources](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Limited Resources) and... [Rolling Stones](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rolling Stones). It's satisfying to kill someone with walls, I tell you.
posts.html:
I play a wall/land destruction deck with Limited Resources and... Rolling Stones. It's satisfying to kill someone with walls, I tell you.

Posted By: nammertime (11/19/2009 11:47:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I give this card big points because it really emotes its name with the relevant abilities. You can just picture this devastating defense setup with living walls, walls of bone, etc. It really does make your defense pretty devastating as well. If you have a regenerating wall mixed into the lot like [Living Wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living Wall) or [Wall of Bone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Bone) you can drive someone bannanas.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This is kind of funny.  
Now that I think of it, this enchantment is essentially the same as the Dark Ascension "lords" ([Immerwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Immerwolf), [Diregraf Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Captain), [Stromkirk Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Captain), [Drogskol Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drogskol Captain)) except it doesn't improve it's creature type's toughness.  
  
Remember, like first strike, Banding was an ability that WAS usable. Back in the day, this may have been a decent card.
posts.html:
This is kind of funny.
Now that I think of it, this enchantment is essentially the same as the Dark Ascension "lords" (Immerwolf, Diregraf Captain, Stromkirk Captain, Drogskol Captain) except it doesn't improve it's creature type's toughness.

Remember, like first strike, Banding was an ability that WAS usable. Back in the day, this may have been a decent card.
